main.name: Ming Shane Tong
main.description: I am a Software Engineer located in Wellington, New Zealand. I graduated from Victoria University of Wellington with a Bachelor of Science majoring in Computer Science and Mathematics and specialising in Artifical Intelligence.
main.bio: I have a strong interest in web development, data analysis and machine learning and seeking a role as a software developer where I can utilize my proficient problem-solving skills and my technical experience in software engineering. I am passion about exploring technology and algorithms to build solutions to overcomes difficult challenges. I am motivated by the lessons that I learn from working on a range of projects as it teaches me skills that I can carry into my next challenge.
main.contactmessage: Please use the following form to get in touch with me. Messages are sent through Google Forms.

cv.skillmessage: Here you can create a short write-up of your skills to show off to employers

education.degree: Bachelor of Science, Computer Science and Mathematics

positions.title: Software Engineer / Graduate Analyst Developer
description: Developed and maintained automated smoke and regression tests using Selenium utilizing the Page Object Model.
Advanced misuse testing using Cypress.io to automate the detection of common vulnerabilities on over two thousand pages on client platforms at FNZ.
Utilized the Cucumber framework to guide testing under the Behavioral Driven Development methodology.
Resolved security defects present in the applications.

positions.title: Intern Analyst Developer
description: Created a web application to monitor the uptime of software environments to detect and prevent issues during usage and before deployment.
Built the backend and Windows Service application that schedules the time to perform a health check on the environment and implemented an API to allow the data to be requested by the website.
Improved the software architecture of the application by taking into consideration the discoveries made in the previous design and listening from experiences of developers in the team.

positions.title: Computer Science Course Tutor
description: Tutored for the Computer Science Introductory courses, COMP102 and COMP103, teaching over four hundred students in each course fundamental programming concepts and techniques.
Assisted students in their learning by organizing tutorials, marking assignments, and offering suggestions and feedback.

projects.subtitle: Fitness & Wellness Coaching Platform
projects.title: Fit & Healthy
projects.description: Server rendered, progressive web application for online fitness & health coaching. Providing workout programs, nutritions plans, workout logs, follow up with client's progress and more.
